intro: Parathelypteris musashiensis, commonly known as the Musashi fern, is a species of fern native to Japan. It belongs to the family Athyriaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its reproductive structures, including sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. The botanical features of Parathelypteris musashiensis make it an interesting subject for study in both horticulture and ecological research.
